selected_quotes: EU emergency brake: the UK and the EU are making this up as they go along
Emergency brake to suspend welfare payments to EU migrants may need oiling
There's a reason why you've never heard of the emergency brake – no one's ever really used it
Why you've never heard of the emergency brake? No one's ever really used it until … #Brexit htt…

citation.abstract: David Cameron hopes to please eurosceptics by applying a mechanism to suspend welfare payments to EU migrants. Here's how it works.
citation.title: Explainer: what is the EU emergency brake?

news.title: Four key parts of Britain's new deal with Europe explained by an expert in EU law
news.summary: Proposals on the UK’s future relationship with the European Union have given British voters a first indication of what David Cameron, the prime minister, has achieved in his attempts to renegotiate the terms of the UK’s membership.

news.title: Why the EU emergency brake on migrant benefits is sexist
news.summary: Since the plan on renegotiating the UK’s position in the EU was published, there has been a lot of talk about whether it offers a good enough compromise to placate eurosceptic politicians.

news.title: Why the EU emergency brake on migrant benefits is sexist

brake on migrant benefits is sexist

news.title: Bad news for most vulnerable as court rules UK can restrict child benefit for EU migrants
news.summary: As the campaign ahead of the UK referendum on EU membership reached its endpoint, the European Court of Justice (ECJ) declared that UK restrictions on the access that EU citizens have to child benefit and child tax credit in Britain were lawful.

news.title: Immigration after Brexit: what are the alternatives to a points-based system?
news.summary: Brexit was supposed to be about “taking back control” of our borders and the new prime minister, Theresa May, has confirmed that immigration control will be a “red line” in any negotiations with the EU.
